text.p: Grain and oilseed exports reported by USDA and private export sources.

WHEAT SALE - The European Union on Tuesday confirmed the award of a food aid tender to deliver 45,000 tonnes of common wheat to Bangladesh, including 25,000 tonnes at 155.85 Ecus a tonne and the balance at 159.43 Ecus. Delivery dates were not specified but a European Commission official said the wheat aid was due to be shipped during March. (1 Ecu = $1.14)
SOYMEAL TENDERS - The Korea Feed Association on Tuesday passed on tenders for 60,000 tonnes of soymeal due to high offer prices, traders said.

CORN TENDERS - The state-owned National Cereals and Produce Board said it awarded tenders to three companies for the supply of 100,000 tonnes of corn for drought victims in Kenya. The corn will be sourced from southern Africa and the United States and must be supplied between now and end-April, said the NCPB, which announced the tenders on Monday. WHEAT TENDERS - Two Philippine mills plan to buy 40,000 tonnes of U.S. wheat for April shipment, Manila grains traders said on Tuesday.

WHEAT TENDERS - Syria's General Establishment for Cereal Processing and Trade has offered 50,000 tonnes of hard durum amber wheat for sale, a company spokesman said on Tuesday. March 8 was the final date for receiving bids and results would be announced on March 9. The wheat, from the 1995 crop, would be ready for shipment between April 15 and May 15. Partial offers would be accepted and partial shipment allowed.
- Algeria has launched a tender for the purchase of 75,000 tonnes of French or Argentine or U.S. soft wheat or any combination of the three, European grain traders said Monday.

WHEAT TENDERS - Japan will re-tender for 20,000 tonnes of U.S. wheat and 20,000 of Canadian barley on March 6. The agency bought 180,000 tonnes of wheat and 60,000 of barley on Thursday, but it did not purchase 20,000 tonnes of U.S. wheat and 20,000 of Canadian barley due to price.

- Slovenia will seek on Wednesday a total of 30,000 tonnes optional origin milling quality wheat, several U.S. exporters said. The estimated arrival date in Slovenia was April 12 and the tender was believed to be private, one exporter said. No other details were available.

WHEAT TENDER - Peru will tender on Tuesday for between 20,000 and 25,000 tonnes optional origin durum, several U.S. exporters said. One exporter said he believed the durum would be of U.S. origin. Shipment date was slated for March 15-April 15. Estimated date of arrival was by April 30.

CORN, SOY AND WHEAT TENDER - High international prices mean Taiwanese buyers are likely to be lukewarm participants in grain and oilseed markets this week, traders said. One tender for 54,000 tonnes of soybeans and corn and two shipments totalling 69,000 tonnes of U.S. wheat for the Taiwan Flour Mills Association are scheduled in the next few days.

MARKET TALK - The French port of Rouen is expected to load its first cargo of wheat for Iraq under a United Nations oil-for-food scheme at the end of this week, freight sources said. Grain freighter Freedom K is anchored outside the port and plans to berth by the end of the week to load 23,350 tonnes of wheat for distribution in Iraq, they said. France has sold 600,000 tonnes of wheat to Iraq under the U.N. plan to ease Gulf War sanctions by raising money for humanitarian supplies of food and medicine through oil sales.
... Philippine livestock farmers and feed millers have asked the National Food Authority (NFA) to speed up corn imports due to rising demand, government and industry officials said on Tuesday.

... Russia is interested in buying a variety of U.S. agricultural goods, ranging from wheat and wheat products to soybeans and cotton, the U.S. Agriculture Department's General Sales Manager said Tuesday.
